page.title: 02Government and Services
page.content:
Skirlaugh is in the County of Humberside and in the Borough of South Holderness.
Before counties were re-organised the village was in the East Riding of Yorkshire and many of the residents still regard themselves as Yorkshire folk, not Humbersiders. A considerable number still use Yorkshire in their postal address.
Most of the community ammenities are provided by the County Council and the Borough Council but some responsibility rests with a locally elected Parish Council.
Water supply is in the control of the Yorkshire Water Authority. Electricity is from the national network. There is no mains gas in the village.
